speaker: Whitespire Tundra
line: A white plain under a hard sky. Old cairns poke through the drift like knuckles trying to pray.

speaker: Wind
line: It speaks in small syllables—ice against ice—too quick to be a language, too deliberate to be noise.

choices.text: Take the next contract tied to the wastes.
Mark Whitespire Tundra as a checkpoint.

speaker: Whitespire Tundra
line: Your footprints fill with snow before you finish making them.
